org.exquisite.tests.communication

Class DiagnosisServerThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • org.exquisite.tests.communication.DiagnosisServerThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class DiagnosisServerThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    A thread for handling requests from a client.

    This thread is instantiated when the Server has accepted a connection from a client. The Socket object returned from Server when it accepted the connection is passed to this thread.

    Inside Run, a ServerProtocol object is instantiated that contains the logic for how to respond to particular messages from the client. Messages from the client are then routed to the ServerProtocol object and conversely the responses from ServerProtocol are then sent back over the socket connection to the client.

    Author:
    David
    See Also:
    Server, org.exquisite.protocol.ServerProtocol

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Set up the PrintStream, reads requests from a client and posts results back.

        Closes the socket when requested by the client, when client issues a DISCONNECT request, goes offline or some other error.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
